New Records: The Kansas City Royals became the first team to lose 100 games, then win a playoff series in a "normal" season the following year.
Bobby Witt Jr. became the second player in MLB history to record game-winning RBIs in each of his first two playoff games.
Key Match Events: The Royals won the series in a two-game sweep, with a 1-0 win on Tuesday and a 2-1 win on Wednesday.
Bobby Witt Jr. delivered the go-ahead single in both contests.
The starting pitching and closer Lucas Erceg did the heavy lifting in the wins.
Post-Match Reflections: The Royals' win showed that they have a legitimate formula to win in the playoffs.
The team's performance was emblematic of who they were as a team all season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals will caravan into the Bronx to face the New York Yankees this weekend, and are a real threat to the top remaining power in the AL.
Justin Verlander wants to keep pitching, and is a potential fit for the Royals.
Others: The Royals' Wild Card series win marked their first playoff advancement since 2015.
